content.description: A slopey dab fest. Make your way out of a crevice, on pretty good slopers, but terrible feet, all why trying to not dab the rock behind you.
content.location: This is on the actual Mr. Longarm boulder in the crevice between Mr. Longarm and The Penthouse. Enter the crevice on the middle of the west side of the largest boulder. Enter the hole and go deeper (south) to a set of pretty good slopers at head height. Traverse left form there and ultimately up. Don't dab!

content.description:
Cruxy compression joins "The Penthouse". 3ish tough slaps leads to easier climbing.

Drew has not yet logged this on 8a.nu.  "Tax Evasion" is what I was calling it as a project so I will update the name once he logs.
content.location: This is the  south face of the "Mr. Longarm" boulder. Start sitting low on the left side of the boulder, left hand on a rounded edge right hand on a small crimp.

content.description: Good features on a cool corner of a block. Someone did a lot of work to clear the poison oak away from this climb and while they may not be the hero we deserve, they are the hero we need.
content.location: At the Mr. Longarm Area (the North Cluster of boulders on the obvious rise), this boulder is about 50 feet south of the main outcropping and the climb is on the south east corner

content.description: Sit start on a good left hand side pull and a lower right hand crimp. Big first move to a good edge then continue left and up. Almost always in the sun so it probably feels harder than it really is.
content.location: South side of boulders, problem faces south.

content.description: SDS at two small incut crimps, fire for the ledge and climb to the top.
content.location: north side of boulders, problem faces NW

content.description: SDS compression with two holds facing opposite way, get the feet set and climb to better holds.

Short and easy warm-up problem just to the right of penthouse overlooking the trail. Start at the small sloper and stand into the first set of many good jugs. Slab your way up to the top with good but not obvious feet and hands. Overall pretty easy warm-up to run laps on but be careful as a fall will send you tumbling down the side of the hill.
content.protection: You can pad it but I would just recommend not falling.
content.location: The boulder is on top of the hill north of the water. Just to the right of Penthouse, it is the face that overlooks the trail. Coming south from Carson's crossing, it's the first face that you see sitting on the hill.

content.description: Start on the big fat sloper on the bottom left corner of the boulder when facing the front of this climb and work your way up and to the right, then around the corner, and all the way to the back of the boulder on the opposite side of the slab to top out.  Crux is probably the beginning when slapping for the first move or the middle when transitioning off a good sidepull.  Really fun route that I would warm up on before working The Penthouse.
content.location:
Boulder that sits directly in front of the penthouse boulder and the route is on the opposite side of the slab that faces the penthouse.

Here's a video of the send:

youtube.com/watch?v=PScTGnG…
